title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
An outside panel of advisers to the FDA narrowly recommended that the agency authorize the experimental Covid-19 oral antiviral from Merck and Ridgeback. The recommendation is limited to high-risk people.

The Biden administration is weighing stricter Covid-19 testing requirements for travelers entering the U.S., including U.S. citizens, to slow the spread of the emerging Omicron variant.

A federal judge issued a temporary nationwide block against a Biden administration mandate that millions of healthcare workers get vaccinated against Covid-19 starting next week.

---

Mark Meadows, Trump's last White House chief of staff, agreed to speak to a Democratic-led House committee investigating the Jan. 6 assault on the Capitol.

---

NATO warned that its members would impose significant costs on Russia if it launched a new military incursion in Ukraine, while making clear the limits of the organization's support for Ukraine.

---

European diplomats said negotiations to revive nuclear talks could be terminated if Iran moved to produce weapons-grade nuclear fuel.

---

A federal appeals court in California upheld the state's ban on large-capacity firearm magazines, reversing earlier rulings that had found the restriction unconstitutional.

---

Barbados officially became a republic, ending almost four centuries of ties to the British monarchy.
